intro: Heteropterys ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf heteropterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its ovate,革质 (leathery) leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It produces elliptical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Heteropterys ovalifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
